author: performx92
body: Tough ER week ahead: Google, Apple, NXP (semiconductor), GE, Starbucks, AMD, Facebook. Trump walking out of pressers with no Q&A probably because of his bleach and sunlight injection comments, and the leader of NK might be dead. Oh don’t forget US GDP report on Wednesday, followed by more job reports Thursday. **its going to be a hell of a week.** I want to believe that this EOD rally was the final hoorah for the bulls, my puts need it.. down 30k in about 3weeks 🌈🐻

author: SnowdensOfYesteryear
body:
You forgot TI!

Throwing a few more random names out there: STMicro, NXP (did they get eaten by QCOM?), Microchip

I actually don't understand why there are so many companies making microcontrollers.  At this point, they're basically commodities.

author: SponsorsExemption
body:
ER Tommorow

Before Open:  Southwest, 3M, Pfizer, Pepsi, Caterprillar, Merck, BP

After Close: AMD, Alphabet, Starbucks NXP.

Who we bullish on?

author: hr-puf-n-stuf
body:
Bought 100 NXPI @ $30, and my father got it $15.  Still holding today.  Bought in when i found out they owned much of the tech surrounding NFC.  Just before everyone started moving to putting it in cell phones.  Has lots of auto applications too.  

AMD @ 15, 300 shares - sold at $48 recently. 

AAPL @ $50, sold at $200.  Before the app/itunes stores really took off, or the iphone was released if i recall. 

Losers too like FIT, @ $15, still holding too.  Was hoping the Google purchase would have boosted it more.  Just one disappointing product release after another.  Needs new senior leadership, their real strength is their community, not their products.  I think they fail to realize its importance.  The community is what grows their base, and pushes to their products or supplemental services.

body: You fuckers bullish or bearish on NXPI

author: nichemkt
body: Who still have ZM long-term puts -- "Daimler AG, Ericsson AB, NXP Semiconductors NV and Bank of America Corp. are among a wave of companies forbidding or warning employees against using Zoom because of concerns about its security, according to people familiar with their operations. They join corporations like Tesla Inc. and government agencies from Taiwan to Singapore that have banned the app’s use, though the city-state has since backtracked. India has deemed Zoom an unsafe platform and initiated a public contest to develop a secure homegrown video-chat alternative. "

author: UnluckyBanana3
body:
This is a good list. I usually go through you list and see if theres anything i'm interested in buying or at least watching.

buys- BWEN, C, ERI, RCL

CAKE should make a comeback but they've gotten a lot of bad press during the pandemic for not paying their rent/mortgage. FFIV I've never heard of but they seem to skyrocketing in the technology world, or is that everything in the market at the moment? HOG, SIX, WYNN should be up with the summer. NXPI looks to finally be bouncing back from the crash. TAL is an education group, they look like a really good buy, their stocks seem to have always been trending up. YNDX, i have never heard of but they look to deal with ride shares in russia, that doesnt seem like a safe bet. They also offer media services which should be up with the global climate, maybe its not that risky of a buy. UPS didn't perform as well as expected, which i think is weird considering how everyone is ordering everything online.

LH (labcorp) juat got approved for at-home covid 19 test kits. Theyll make a killing 

DCPH, DGX, QTNT- pharmaceuticals, obvious buy. BPMC should come back as well being a pharmaceutical company.
